questions.question: What is the space complexity of IDDFS? (Here b is the branching factor, d is the depth of the goal node, and m is the maximum depth of the graph.)

explanations.a: Check Space and Time complexity section in the Theory section.
explanations.b: Check Space and Time complexity section in the Theory section.
explanations.c: Check Space and Time complexity section in the Theory section.
explanations.d: Check Space and Time complexity section in the Theory section.

questions.question: In a graph traversal problem, the goal node is located at a depth of 4. How many iterations of IDDFS would be needed to guarantee finding the goal node?
What happens when visited nodes are not kept track of in IDDFS?

answers.a: The IDDFS algorithm will still find the optimal solution.
answers.b: The IDDFS algorithm may get stuck in an infinite loop.
answers.c: The IDDFS algorithm will terminate but may not find the optimal solution.
answers.d: The IDDFS algorithm will be faster but may miss some nodes.
answers.e: The IDDFS algorithm will not work at all and fail to find any solution.

explanations.b: It will continuously re-visit nodes, since they haven't been marked and therefore closed, causing a loop.

questions.question: Consider the following graph: A->B, A->C, B->D, B->E, C->F. What will be the order of nodes visited in IDDFS starting from node A?

answers.a: A, B, D, E, C, F
answers.b: A, B, C, D, E, F
answers.c: A, A, B, D, E, A, A, C, F
answers.d: A, A, B, C, A, B, D, E, C, F

explanations.a: This is the order of nodes visited in DFS, not IDDFS.
explanations.b: This is the order of nodes visited in BFS, not IDDFS.

questions.question: Consider the following graph: A->B, A->C, B->D, D->E. How many nodes will be visited before reaching node C in IDDFS and DFS?

explanations.a: IDDFS - A, A, B, C; DFS - A, B, D, E, C
explanations.b: IDDFS - A, A, B, C; DFS - A, B, D, E, C
explanations.c: IDDFS - A, A, B, C; DFS - A, B, D, E, C
explanations.d: IDDFS - A, A, B, C; DFS - A, B, D, E, C
